results.title: Lockdown finally coming to an end
results.brief_description: After winning the unenvious title of most lock-down city in the world, Melbournians could certainly relate to Willy the Whale’s fantastic feeling of freedom in the pivotal scene of early 90’s classic, Free Willy. Originally posted in 2020 at the end of Victoria’s mammoth 112-day lockdown number two, the clip, feels all the more relevant in 2021 after a total of 263 days spent across six periods of lockdown captivity.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

After living in one of the world’s most locked-down cities, Melburnians could certainly relate to Willy the whale’s feeling of freedom in the climax of early 90s classic, Free Willy. Originally posted in 2020 at the end of Victoria’s mammoth 112-day second lockdown, the clip feels all the more relevant in 2021 after a total of 262 days spent across six periods of stay-at-home orders.
description_for_label: After living in one of the world’s most locked-down cities, Melburnians could certainly relate to Willy the whale’s feeling of freedom in the climax of early 90s classic, Free Willy. Originally posted in 2020 at the end of Victoria’s mammoth 112-day second lockdown, the clip feels all the more relevant in 2021 after a total of 262 days spent across six periods of stay-at-home orders.

results.title: Workman's nightmare
results.brief_description:
An early experiment filmed in the Straford backyard in Brighton. It features the acting debut of 14 year-old John - as a workman who tussles with an unruly ladder.
This short work from 1951 marked the boys earliest efforts.

results.title: Robert
results.creator_credit: Cedric Smith, Wolf Koenig, Signe Johansson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
Robert tells of the identity crisis of a fifteen-year-old whose father walked out years earlier. Already overwhelmed by problems at school, despair at the situation of the world, and his awkwardness with girls, Robert suddenly discovers that his mother has a serious boyfriend. One of a series of six short dramatic discussion starters for adolescents and adults on the subject of teenage alienation.

results.title: Victor/Victoria
results.creator_credit: Blake Edwards, Tony Adams, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Ladbroke Entertainment
results.brief_description: Sparkling, ultra-sophisticated entertainment from Blake Edwards. This story is based on a 1933 German comedy film “Viktor und Viktoria” written and directed by Rheinhold Schunzel. Set in Paris in 1934, it is the tale of a down-on-her luck chanteuse, played by Julie Andrews. Also suffering a temporary career lapse is tres gai nightclub entertainer (Robert Preston), who remakes her as a man who in short order becomes celebrated as Paris’s foremost female impersonator. In the process she snags the attentions of a Chicago nightclub owner (James Garner). He, however, has a small problem - is it a he or a she who has stolen his heart? 1982 Academy Award for Best Original Score (Henry Mancini). Academy Award nominations for Best Actress (Julie Andrews), Supporting Actor (Robert Preston), Supporting Actress (Lesley Anne Warren), Screenplay Adaptation, Costume Design and Art Direction.

constellations_other.name: Marlene Dietrich: queering gender onscreen
constellations_other.description: Marlene Dietrich is an icon of queer style – from her proud bisexuality to her scandalous decision to wear a tuxedo on the red carpet. This constellation explores androgyny, gender non-conformity and drag on screen in the century since Dietrich's performance in Morocco (1930).

results.title: Road trip: after the Gippsland bushfires 2003
results.brief_description:
A road trip through the East Gippsland region of Victoria after the bushfires in 2003 and a chance meeting at a place called Seldom Seen, somewhere between Jindabyne and Buchan, with David Woodburn owner of the “Seldom Seen Service Statiion”. David talks of his encounter with the fires, his loss of his family home, the service station and many of his pet animals including an emu and an ostrich. But it is David’s eccentricity and sardonic humour, along with the wonderful quirky photographic shots that makes this story so engaging and appealing.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.

results.title: Baby girl
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Chrissy Ponting
results.brief_description: Life is very challenging for Chrissy as a teenage mum but through her love for daughter Lakeisha combined with the support of family and friends, she has been able to complete her school studies and begin training as a nurse. This is dedicated to her baby girl.

results.title: Jenny
results.creator_credit: Patricia Phillips, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wednesday’s children”.
Part of a series of six short dramas for adolescents and adults on teenage alienation, Jenny is the story of a seemingly tough seventeen-year-old who is arrested for trafficking drugs. Jenny’s story emerges as she is interviewed by a skilful social worker. Her unemployed, alcoholic father has been sexually abusing her, and is now turning his attention to her weaker, younger sister as well.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Phillips, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Magic place
results.creator_credit: Goulburn Ovens Institute of TAFE, Linton Briggs, Kathy Whelan and David Briggs
results.brief_description:
Narrated to a background of archival home movie images juxtaposed with contemporary images of Lake Mokoan and the surrounding landscape, local resident Linton Briggs gives his account of the changes which have taken place since the decommissioning of the Lake. He speaks of a magic place, Winton Swamp, where wildlife was in abundance, where a wet-land ecosystem of bird-life, Murray cod, Red-gums, and every variety of duck imaginable used to exist and of his sadness and apprehension the changing of the lake may make to the ecological balance of Lake Mokoan.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.
